title: Enhancing Mastery of Mathematical Concepts through Metacognition and Peer Tutoring

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of secondary-level mathematics fundamentals (equations, functions, geometry, etc.) and practical application experience
context.additional_context: A program designed to enhance job competencies for current practitioners, operating in smartphone-based, limited-technology environments. Measures learning outcomes through summative assessments and emphasizes improving conceptual application skills via peer collaborative learning.

learning_goals: Learners Can Systematically Plan the Problem-Solving Process for Complex Mathematical Problems Using Metacognitive Strategies (e.g., Self-Questioning, Error Analysis)
Learners Develop the Competency to Assess Team Members’ Conceptual Understanding and Provide Tailored Feedback Through Peer Tutoring Activities
Learners Can Independently Correct Over 80% of Errors Occurring During the Application of Mathematical Concepts to Real-World Scenarios in PBL Tasks

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
